TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a claim with ORG against the local land department . He sought the acknowledgement of his ownership title over a land plot which according to him was within his family estate .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a claim with ORG of GPE against the municipal council seeking the ownership certificates in respect of the disputed land to be declared invalid . The CARDINAL claims were subsequently joined into CARDINAL case .
CARDINAL . K. , a private person and the owner of the disputed land plot , participated in the proceedings as a third party .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG left the applicant ’s claims without examination in view of his repeated failure to appear before the court . On DATE the ORG of Appeal quashed the ruling of DATE and sent the case for further examination .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of Odessa found that the applicant had no legal basis to claim a title to the land plot and rejected his claims as unsubstantiated .

CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal which he had to re - submit on several occasions in order to comply with procedural requirements and upheld the judgment of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed in cassation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , acting as a court of cassation , dismissed the applicant ’s appeal in cassation and upheld the decisions of the lower courts .
CARDINAL . The applicant received a copy of the ruling of DATE in DATE after he had lodged a number of enquiries with the courts .

CARDINAL . In the course of the proceedings the applicant lodged a number of procedural requests , some of which were allowed , including those concerning the application of provisional measures , withdrawal of the judges from his case , suspension of the proceedings in view of his health problems and pending the outcome of a criminal case against a private person concerning the matter . He also lodged appeals against some of the procedural rulings and requested copies of documents from the case - file . On CARDINAL occasions the applicant failed to appear before the courts or requested adjournment of the hearings because of his health problems which caused a delay of DATE . Another DATE delay was caused by respondents’ non - appearance before the courts .
